events.title: United States Breaks Diplomatic Ties with Germany
events.description: The United States government severed diplomatic relations with Germany during World War I, following Germany's resumption of unrestricted submarine warfare.
events.significance: This marked a turning point that led the US to enter World War I on the side of the Allies.

events.title: Launch of Explorer 1, First U.S. Satellite
events.description: The United States successfully launched its first satellite, Explorer 1, into orbit, marking its entry into the space race.
events.significance: It was the first American response to the Soviet Union's Sputnik, signifying a milestone in space exploration and Cold War competition.

events.title: Apollo 14 Lunar Landing
events.description: Astronauts Alan Shepard and Edgar Mitchell landed on the moon during the Apollo 14 mission, conducting scientific exploration on the lunar surface.
events.significance: This mission helped advance human knowledge of the moon and proved the capabilities for sustained manned lunar missions.

events.title: Hans Asperger Publishes Autism Study
events.description: Austrian pediatrician Hans Asperger published a study describing a group of children with unique social and behavioral traits, later known as Asperger's syndrome.
events.significance: This work contributed to the understanding and diagnosis of autism spectrum disorders.

events.title: India's Constitution Comes into Effect
events.description: India officially adopted its Constitution, becoming a sovereign democratic republic.
events.significance: Marked the establishment of India as an independent republic and the beginning of its democratic governance.
